alert.note: Alert for Berks; Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Berks and Chester Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coatesville, or 12 miles west of West Chester, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Coatesville, Westtown, Downingtown, Kennett Square, Parkesburg, West Grove, Honey Brook, Elverson, New Morgan, Cochranville, Pughtown, Marshallton, Lionville-Marchwood, Glenmoore, Landenberg, Chester Springs, Lionville, Paoli and West Goshen. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 320. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
